options.content:
# Prometheus Overiew

The Prometheus monitoring stack can be monitored with its own components.
This dashboard tracks the health and stability of the Prometheus server pods which scrape and store metrics, as well as the PVCs
where they store metrics.

#### OCP:
- **prometheus-k8s** pods scrape metrics from all OpenShift resources including: nodes, pods, containers, PVC, etc.
- **prometheus-user-workload** pods scrape custom metrics from AIOps component pods

To learn more about configuring your Prometheus monitoring stack on OCP see: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-aiops/4.11.0?topic=grafana-configuring-enabling-openshift-container-platform-monitoring

#### Linux:
- **prometheus-prometheus** pod scrapes metrics from Kubernetes resources including: nodes, pods, containers, PVC, as well as custom metrics from AIOps component pods.

panels.description:
Count that tracks the number of pods that were newly created within the time range.

New pods indicate restarts may have occurred which could result in loss of functionality. Review the component pod uptime time series to see if any gaps in uptime occurred.

New pods don't always indicate a problem and in some cases are part of routine processing and scaling.

0.text: pods are stable - no new pods within time range

1.text: 1 new pod within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

2.text: 2 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

3.text: 3 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

4.text: 4 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

5.text: 5 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

6.text: 6 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

7.text: 7 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

8.text: 8 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

9.text: 9 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

result.text: 10-20 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps
21-40 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps
41+ new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

defaults.noValue: pods are stable - no new pods within time range

panels.description:
Current pod phase of the prometheus server pods.

OCP: If monitoring is enabled and configured, there should be a total of 4 pods running: 2 prometheus-k8s pods & 2 prometheus-user-workload pods

Linux: If monitoring is enabled and configured, there should be a single prometheus server pod running: prometheus-prometheus
panels.title: Prometheus Server Pods

panels.description:
Count of pods that have exceeded 80% of their CPU limits within the time range. This will result in CPU throttling and potentially temporary loss of functionality

This will only compare against the ***current*** CPU limit of each pod. If the limits were updated within the time range, the count may be inaccurate.

0.text: pod-level CPU usage is stable - all usage has stayed under 80% of current limits

1.text: 1 pod has exceeded 80% of their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

2.text: 2 pods have exceeded 80% of their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

3.text: 3 pods have exceeded 80% of their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

4.text: 4 pods have exceeded 80% of their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

result.text: 5+ pods have exceeded 80% of their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

targets.expr: sum((((max(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{pod=~".*prometheus-k8s.*|.*prometheus-user.*|.*prometheus-prometheus.*", container!="", container!="POD", container!="config-reloader", resource="cpu"}) by (pod)) * 0.8 <= max(max_over_time(node_namespace_pod_container:container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:sum_irate{pod=~".*prometheus-k8s.*|.*prometheus-user.*|.*prometheus-prometheus.*", container!="", container!="config-reloader", container!="POD"}[$__range])) by (pod)) or vector(0)) > bool 0)

panels.description:
Count of pods that have exceeded 80% of their memory limits within the time range.

This will only compare against the ***current*** memory limit of each pod. If the limits were updated within the time range, the count may be inaccurate.

0.text: pod-level memory usage is stable - all usage has stayed under 80% of current limits

1.text: 1 pod has exceeded 80% of their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

2.text: 2 pods have exceeded 80% of their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

3.text: 3 pods have exceeded 80% of their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

4.text: 4 pods have exceeded 80% of their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

result.text: 5+ pods have exceeded 80% of their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

targets.expr: sum((((max(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{pod=~".*prometheus-k8s.*|.*prometheus-user.*|.*prometheus-prometheus.*", container!="", container!="POD", container!="config-reloader", resource="memory"}) by (pod)) * 0.8 <= max(max_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{pod=~".*prometheus-k8s.*|.*prometheus-user.*|.*prometheus-prometheus.*", container!="", container!="POD", container!="config-reloader"}[$__range])) by (pod)) or vector(0)) > bool 0)

panels.description:
Count of pods that have exceeded their CPU limits within the time range. This will result in CPU throttling and potentially temporary loss of functionality.

This will only compare against the ***current*** CPU limit of each pod. If the limits were updated within the time range, the count may be inaccurate.

0.text: all pod-level CPU usage has stayed under current limits

1.text: 1 pod has exceeded their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

2.text: 2 pods have exceeded their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

3.text: 3 pods have exceeded their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

4.text: 4 pods have exceeded their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

result.text: 5+ pods have exceeded their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

targets.expr: sum((((max(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{pod=~".*prometheus-k8s.*|.*prometheus-user.*|.*prometheus-prometheus.*", container!="", container!="POD", container!="config-reloader", resource="cpu"}) by (pod)) <= max(max_over_time(node_namespace_pod_container:container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:sum_irate{pod=~".*prometheus-k8s.*|.*prometheus-user.*|.*prometheus-prometheus.*", container!="", container!="POD", container!="config-reloader"}[$__range])) by (pod)) or vector(0)) > bool 0)

panels.description:
Count of component pods that have exceeded their memory limits within the time range.

This will only compare against the ***current*** memory limit of each pod. If the limits were updated within the time range, the count may be inaccurate.

0.text: all pod-level memory usage has stayed under current limits

1.text: 1 pod has exceeded their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

2.text: 2 pods have exceeded their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

3.text: 3 pods have exceeded their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

4.text: 4 pods have exceeded their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

result.text: 5+ pods have exceeded their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

targets.expr: sum((((max(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{pod=~".*prometheus-k8s.*|.*prometheus-user.*|.*prometheus-prometheus.*", container!="", container!="POD", container!="config-reloader", resource="memory"}) by (pod)) <= max(max_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{pod=~".*prometheus-k8s.*|.*prometheus-user.*|.*prometheus-prometheus.*", container!="", container!="POD", container!="config-reloader"}[$__range])) by (pod)) or vector(0)) > bool 0)

panels.description: Prometheus user workload CPU Usage. OCP only, no metrics will appear for linux-based installations.
panels.title: Prometheus user workload CPU Usage (OCP only)

panels.description: Prometheus User Workload Memory Usage. OCP only, no metrics will appear for linux-based installations.
panels.title: Prometheus User Workload Memory Usage (OCP only)

panels.description: Count of monitoring PVCs in a "bound" state
panels.title: Bound monitoring PVCs

panels.description:
PVC usage percentage for each PVC in the monitoring namespaces, thresholds of 85% & 95% usage.

Prometheus PVC usage should stabilize after reaching its retention period. If it appears that the PVC is filling up too fast, expand PVC or shorten the retention period to ensure the PVC doesn't run out.
panels.title: PVC Usage

panels.description: Count of "lost" or "pending" PVCs in the monitoring namespaces.
panels.title: Unbound PVC

panels.description: Max and current PVC usage. Prometheus PVC usage should stabilize after reaching its retention period. If it appears that the PVC is filling up too fast, expand PVC or shorten the retention period to ensure the PVC doesn't run out.
panels.title: PVC Usage (max & current)

title: IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps - Prometheus Monitoring Stack
